content:
Thunderbird is a free, open-source program. Donations are suggested but not required to download, install, or use it.

Please be sure you downloaded it from the official site, not some questionable, possibly malicious one.

https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/

If a donation window pops up after you have started the download, the download will still continue as normal, and you should be able to just hit <ESC> to make the window go away.
creator: rednoise

content:
No, there is not. There is the sneaky system used by spammers as well as "legitimate" senders that embed a link in an HTML-formatted message to an external image, often just one invisible pixel. Retrieving this image, sometimes called a "web beacon" will alert a monitoring server somewhere that can tell the sender that the recipient has opened the email... *IF* the recipient is set up to automatically display external images. The average sender wouldn't usually have a way to monitor this - it requires access to a web server.

Thunderbird (and virtually all other) email clients have a setting to disable auto image display, and I would encourage everyone to do so. You can enable auto-download for trusted senders if you want, but I would still discourage it. Safer to do it manually.

In other words, yes, there is at least that method, but it's easily defeated, which pretty much makes it uselessly unreliable.
creator: rednoise

content:
Yeah, your attempt to fix your issue would only make it worse. Word is designed to put print on paper, it really does not do a very good job with web fonts.

In all probability you are using a font that only exists on your computer, so recipients get some sort of garbage facsimile.

  1. What font are you using?
  2. What provider are you sending your mail through? Yahoo for instance has a rather troubled history of sending mail in any language but US English.
  3. Does this change appear in your sent folder or only in the recipients inbox?
  4. What version of Thunderbird are you using?
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Do you have these settings: uncheck 'Place a copy in' in the Copies & Folders section of Account Settings, since gmail automatically copies sent messages to Sent Mail. Right-click the account in the Folder Pane, Subscribe, and subscribe Sent Mail (it will show as Sent in the Folder Pane in TB 147).

content: Can you be more precise? Which messages do you want to highlight? Are you using the "Table" view or "Cards" view for your thread pane? In Table view Thunderbird by default highlights the background of a selected message: • when the thread pane is in focus the highlight (background) color is blue most of the times, it depends on the accent color you choose in your OS • when the thread pane is out of focus the the background color becomes a light gray (my screen shots have been made in table view)
creator: Mapenzi

content:
Select the account in the left pane of Account Settings, then click Edit SMTP server in the right pane. What is the authentication method shown, and is the User Name (email address) the same as for the selected account?

If the setup is correct, there is one oauth:// entry in Saved Passwords that applies to the incoming and outgoing servers.
creator: sfhowes

content: Grazie Next, sì, forse non mi sono spiegato bene. Ti allego due screenshot di Thunderbird in modalità risoluzione problemi (che avevo già provato): 1. thunderbird-01.png con vista tabella 2. thunderbird-02.png con vista scheda Nel primo vedo il Mittente o Da che poi è Da(CB) cioè di Cardbook: non cambia scegliendo l'uno o l'altro. Nel secondo mette il mio nome e non c'è stato verso di cambiarlo, neanche preso a martellate. L'unica cosa che non ho provato è modificare il file di configurazione, ma non conosco il linguaggio. Anche se in fondo sarebbe facile cambiare semplicemente un'opzione, ma non credo possa servire. Spero che il problema sia più chiaro. Arigrazie per il tuo interessamento Filippo
